docs.snippet: Arsenal midfielder Jack Wilshere, who missed the last two months of the season after fracturing his foot, says he will be fit to play for England at the World Cup.
docs.lead_paragraph: Arsenal midfielder Jack Wilshere, who missed the last two months of the season after fracturing his foot, says he will be fit to play for England at the World Cup.

headline.main: England Midfielder Wilshere 'Fit for World Cup'
headline.print_headline: England Midfielder Wilshere 'Fit for World Cup'

docs.snippet: Form may be temporary, as the saying goes, but when a World Cup is at stake temporary attributes can be crucial to a successful campaign and statistics revealed this week suggest Germany and Uruguay could have the edge over other favourites in...
docs.lead_paragraph: Form may be temporary, as the saying goes, but when a World Cup is at stake temporary attributes can be crucial to a successful campaign and statistics revealed this week suggest Germany and Uruguay could have the edge over other favourites in Brazil.

headline.main: Stats Don’t Lie: Germans and Uruguay Hot for Brazil 2014
headline.print_headline: Stats Don’t Lie: Germans and Uruguay Hot for Brazil 2014

docs.snippet: U.S. sportswear group Nike is banking on its sponsorship of more of the world's best-known soccer stars than Adidas in its battle to overtake the German firm as the sport's top-selling brand at its World Cup this summer.
docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. sportswear group Nike is banking on its sponsorship of more of the world's best-known soccer stars than Adidas in its battle to overtake the German firm as the sport's top-selling brand at its World Cup this summer.

headline.main: Nike and Adidas Get Personal in Battle Over Soccer World Cup
headline.print_headline: Nike and Adidas Get Personal in Battle Over Soccer World Cup

docs.snippet: Rivals Brazil and Argentina are set to meet in the World Cup final in July, with the host country winning the title for a record sixth time, U.S. investment bank Goldman Sachs have predicted in a report.
docs.lead_paragraph: Rivals Brazil and Argentina are set to meet in the World Cup final in July, with the host country winning the title for a record sixth time, U.S. investment bank Goldman Sachs have predicted in a report.

headline.main: Goldman Sees Brazil Beating Argentina in 2014 Cup Final
headline.print_headline: Goldman Sees Brazil Beating Argentina in 2014 Cup Final

docs.snippet: U.S. sportswear group Nike is banking on its sponsorship of more of the world's best-known soccer stars than Adidas in its battle to overtake the German firm as the sport's top-selling brand at its World Cup this summer.

docs.snippet: Gianluigi Buffon considers Italy as a reliable team who know their limitations and should at least reach the World Cup quarter-finals, the stalwart goalkeeper said on Wednesday.
docs.lead_paragraph: Gianluigi Buffon considers Italy as a reliable team who know their limitations and should at least reach the World Cup quarter-finals, the stalwart goalkeeper said on Wednesday.

headline.main: Reliable Italy Aiming for Quarter-Finals, Says Buffon
headline.print_headline: Reliable Italy Aiming for Quarter-Finals, Says Buffon

docs.snippet: As the start of the tournament approaches, several top players are dealing with injuries that might keep them out of the World Cup.
docs.lead_paragraph: As the start of the tournament approaches, several top players are dealing with injuries that might keep them out of the World Cup.

headline.main: Countdown to 2014 World Cup in Brazil: Day 15

docs.snippet: - Defense Secretary Chuck Hagel said on Wednesday he will make decisions fairly soon about detainees at Guantanamo Bay detention center who Uruguay has offered to accept.
docs.lead_paragraph: - Defense Secretary Chuck Hagel said on Wednesday he will make decisions fairly soon about detainees at Guantanamo Bay detention center who Uruguay has offered to accept.

headline.main: Hagel to Make Decisions on Guantanamo Detainees 'Fairly Soon'
headline.print_headline: Hagel to Make Decisions on Guantanamo Detainees 'Fairly Soon'

docs.snippet: England manager Roy Hodgson expected strikers Wayne Rooney and Daniel Sturridge to have little problem clicking despite a lack of playing time together, he said ahead of Friday's World Cup warm-up match against Peru.
docs.lead_paragraph: England manager Roy Hodgson expected strikers Wayne Rooney and Daniel Sturridge to have little problem clicking despite a lack of playing time together, he said ahead of Friday's World Cup warm-up match against Peru.

headline.main: England's Hodgson Backing Rooney and Sturridge to Click
headline.print_headline: England's Hodgson Backing Rooney and Sturridge to Click

docs.snippet: Costa Rica's World Cup hopes suffered a major blow on Thursday when striker Alvaro Saborio was ruled out of next month's finals with a broken bone in his foot.
docs.lead_paragraph: Costa Rica's World Cup hopes suffered a major blow on Thursday when striker Alvaro Saborio was ruled out of next month's finals with a broken bone in his foot.

headline.main: Costa Rica Striker Saborio Out of World Cup With Injury
headline.print_headline: Costa Rica Striker Saborio Out of World Cup With Injury
